file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 55-34-00-04 - DORSAL FIN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL DORSAL FIN - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the dorsal fin. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 55-34-00-000-801-A DORSAL FIN - REMOVAL ALL 55-34-00-400-801-A DORSAL FIN - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 55-34-00 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 55-34-00-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. DORSAL FIN - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the dorsal fin. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 322 Dorsal fin D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area available Commercially Torque wrench To remove the screws available Commercially Acrylic spatula To remove old sealant available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-34-00 Page 2 of 8 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Dorsal fin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) For aircraft with HF system installed, do as follows: (a) On the circuit breaker panel, on the cockpit ceiling, make sure that the HF circuit breaker is open (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/COMM/HF). (b) Remove access panel 322BR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) (Aircraft with HF System) Do the HF antenna disconnection as follows (Figure 402): (a) Remove sealant from the nut (5). (b) Remove the nut (5) and the washer (2) that attach the flat coupler wire (1) to the HF antenna adapter (3). (c) Remove the flat coupler wire (1) from the HF antenna coupler (3). (2) Remove the screws (1) that attach the dorsal fin (2) to the fuselage and vertical stabilizer. (3) Carefully remove the dorsal fin (2). (4) Remove the old aerodynamic sealant and prepare the surface, according to (SRM 51-20-01-PR). WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (5) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-34-00 Page 3 of 8 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

HF ANTENNA 1 ADAPTER B VIEW B DET. A 1 SEALANT (PR1440B2) 2 TORQUE: 2.8-3.4 N.m (25-30 lbf.in) AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH STEEL ADAPTER PIN EM145AMM550034B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 55-34-00 Page 5 of 8 Rev 51 - Oct 31/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 55-34-00-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. DORSAL FIN - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the dorsal fin. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES AMM TASK 23-11-00-700-802-A/500 HF SYSTEM - FUNCTIONAL TEST SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 322 Dorsal fin D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area available Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-81733 TYPE II-2 Sealant, P/S 870 - B 2 AR MIL-PRF-81733 TYPE II-1/2 Sealant, P/S 870 - B 1/2 AR MIL-S-8802 TYPE II Sealant PR1440B-2 AR MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-34-00 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Commercially available Scotch Brite Sponge AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Dorsal fin I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the dorsal fin (2). WARNING:COR-BAN 27L IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY INHALATION. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION GOGGLES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (2) Soak the screws (1) with COR-BAN 27L IS and install them. The screws attaches the dorsal fin (2) to the fuselage and vertical stabilizer. NOTE: For torque, refer to (AMM MPP 20-10-01/200). (3) (Aircraft with HF System) Do the HF antenna connection as follows (Figure 402): (a) Carefully put the flat coupler wire (1) in position. (b) Install the washer (2) and the nut (5) that attach the flat coupler wire (1) to the HF antenna adapter (3). NOTE: Apply torque 2.8 - 3.4 N.m (25-30 lbf.in). (c) Apply sealant over the nut (5) as shown in (Figure 402). (4) Apply aerodynamic sealant P/S 870 - B 2. NOTE: The sealant curing time changes with the environmental conditions. Refer to (SRM 51-20-01-PR). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) (Aircraft with HF System) Do as follows: (a) On the circuit breaker panel, on the cockpit ceiling, make sure that the HF circuit breaker is closed (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/COMM/HF). (b) Do the HF System Functional Test, according to AMM TASK 23-11-00-700-802- A/500. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-34-00 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Install access panel 322BR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). (2) Do the electrical-bonding test procedure as given in AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/ 200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 55-34-00 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
